description:
This modules contains function that operate on items of type date, time, dateTime, and duration.

The module is always imported so you don't need to import it explicitly. Also, you don't need to fully qualify a function to invoke it.

functions.name: adjust-date-to-timezone
functions.description: Adjusts a date value to the implicit timezone.
functions.summary: Adjusts a date value to the implicit timezone.

returns.description: the date in the implicit timezone that contains the starting instant of the supplied date. For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see adjust-date-to-timezone.

functions.name: adjust-date-to-timezone
functions.signature: ($arg as date?, $timezone as dayTimeDuration?) as date?
functions.description: Adjusts a date value to a specific timezone, or to no timezone at all.
functions.summary: Adjusts a date value to a specific timezone, or to no timezone at all.

returns.description:
the date in the target timezone that contains the starting instant of the supplied date.
  • adjust-date-to-timezone(date("2002-03-07"), dayTimeDuration("-PT10H")) returns date("2002-03-06-10:00").
  • adjust-date-to-timezone(date("2002-03-07-07:00"), ()) returns date("2002-03-07").
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see adjust-date-to-timezone

functions.name: adjust-dateTime-to-timezone
functions.description: Adjusts a dateTime value to the implicit timezone.
functions.summary: Adjusts a dateTime value to the implicit timezone.

returns.description: the dateTime in the implicit timezone. For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see adjust-dateTime-to-timezone

functions.name: adjust-dateTime-to-timezone
functions.signature: ($arg as dateTime?, $timezone as dayTimeDuration?) as dateTime
functions.description: Adjusts a dateTime value to the specified timezone, or to no timezone at all.
functions.summary: Adjusts a dateTime value to the specified timezone, or to no timezone at all.

returns.description:
the dateTime in the specified timezone.
  • adjust-dateTime-to-timezone(dateTime('2002-03-07T10:00:00-07:00'), dayTimeDuration("-PT10H")) returns dateTime('2002-03-07T07:00:00-10:00').
  • adjust-dateTime-to-timezone(dateTime('2002-03-07T10:00:00'), ()) returns dateTime('2002-03-07T10:00:00').
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see adjust-dateTime-to-timezone

functions.name: adjust-time-to-timezone
functions.description: Adjusts a time value to an implicit timezone.
functions.summary: Adjusts a time value to an implicit timezone.

returns.description: the time in the implicit timezone. For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see adjust-time-to-timezone

functions.name: adjust-time-to-timezone
functions.signature: ($arg as time?, $timezone as dayTimeDuration?) as time?
functions.description: Adjusts a time value to a specific timezone, or to no timezone at all.
functions.summary: Adjusts a time value to a specific timezone, or to no timezone at all.

returns.description:
the time in the specified timezone.
  • adjust-time-to-timezone(time("10:00:00"), dayTimeDuration("-PT10H")) returns time("07:00:00-10:00").
  • adjust-time-to-timezone(time("10:00:00-07:00"), ()) returns time("10:00:00").
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see adjust-time-to-timezone

functions.name: dateTime
functions.signature: ($arg1 as date?, $arg2 as time?) as dateTime?
functions.description: Returns a dateTime value created by combining a date and a time.
functions.summary: Returns a dateTime value created by combining a date and a time.

returns.description:
the dateTime value created by combinding the given date and time.
  • dateTime(date("1999-12-31"), time("12:00:00")) returns dateTime("1999-12-31T12:00:00").
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see dateTime

functions.name: day-from-date
functions.description: Returns the day component of a date.
functions.summary: Returns the day component of a date.

returns.description:
the day component of the given date.
  • day-from-date(date("1999-05-31-05:00")) returns 31.
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see day-from-date

functions.name: day-from-dateTime
functions.description: Returns the day component of a dateTime.
functions.summary: Returns the day component of a dateTime.

returns.description:
the day component of the given dateTime.
  • day-from-dateTime(dateTime("1999-12-31T20:00:00-05:00")) returns 31.
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see day-from-dateTime

functions.name: days-from-duration
functions.description: Returns the number of days in a duration.
functions.summary: Returns the number of days in a duration.

returns.description:
the number of days in the given duration.
  • days-from-duration(dayTimeDuration("P3DT55H")) returns 5.
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see days-from-duration

functions.name: format-date
functions.signature: ($value as date?, $picture as string) as string?
functions.description: Returns a string containing a date value formatted for display.
functions.summary: Returns a string containing a date value formatted for display.

returns.description:
the string formatted according to the given picture. The following examples assume let $d := date("2002-12-31") and the Gregorian calendar as the default calendar.
  • format-date($d, "[Y0001]-[M01]-[D01]") returns 2002-12-31.
  • format-date($d, "[D1] [MI] [Y]") returns 31 XII 2002.
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see format-date

functions.name: format-date
functions.signature: ($value as date?, $picture as string, $language as string?, $calendar as string?, $place as string?) as string?
functions.description: Returns a string containing a date value formatted for display.
functions.summary: Returns a string containing a date value formatted for display.

returns.description:
the string formatted according to the given picture. The following examples assume let $d := date("2002-12-31") and the Gregorian calendar as the default calendar.
  • format-date($d, "[YWw]", "en", (), ()) returns Two Thousand and Three.
  • format-date($d, "[D] [MNn], [Y]", "de", (), ()) returns 31 Dezember, 2002.
  • format-date($d, "[D\u0E51] [Mn] [Y\u0E51]", "th", "BE", ()) returns ๓๑ ธันวาคม ๒๐๐๒.
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see format-date

functions.name: format-dateTime
functions.signature: ($value as dateTime?, $picture as string) as string?
functions.description: Returns a string containing a dateTime value formatted for display.
functions.summary: Returns a string containing a dateTime value formatted for display.

returns.description:
the string formatted according to the given picture. The following examples assume let $dt := dateTime("2002-12-31T15:58:45") and the Gregorian calendar as the default calendar.
  • format-dateTime($dt, "[h].[m01][Pn] on [FNn], [D1o] [MNn]") returns 3.58pm on Tuesday, 31st December.
  • format-dateTime($dt, "[M01]/[D01]/[Y0001] at [H01]:[m01]:[s01]") returns 12/31/2002 at 15:58:45.
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see format-dateTime

functions.name: format-dateTime
functions.signature: ($value as dateTime?, $picture as string, $language as string?, $calendar as string?, $place as string?) as string?
functions.description: Returns a string containing a dateTime value formatted for display.
functions.summary: Returns a string containing a dateTime value formatted for display.

returns.description: the string formatted according to the given picture. For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see format-dateTime

functions.name: hours-from-dateTime
functions.description: Returns the hours component of a dateTime.
functions.summary: Returns the hours component of a dateTime.

returns.description:
the hours component of the given dateTime.
  • hours-from-dateTime(dateTime("1999-12-31T21:20:00-05:00")) returns 21.
  • hours-from-dateTime(adjust-dateTime-to-timezone(dateTime("1999-12-31T21:20:00-05:00"), dayTimeDuration("PT0S"))) returns 2.
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see hours-from-dateTime

functions.name: hours-from-duration
functions.description: Returns the number of hours in a duration.
functions.summary: Returns the number of hours in a duration.

returns.description:
the number of hours in the given duration.
  • hours-from-duration(dayTimeDuration("P3DT10H")) returns 10.
  • hours-from-duration(dayTimeDuration("-P3DT10H")) returns -10.
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see hours-from-duration

functions.name: hours-from-time
functions.description: Returns the hours component of a time.
functions.summary: Returns the hours component of a time.

returns.description:
the hours component of the given time.
  • hours-from-time(time("11:23:00")) returns 11.
  • hours-from-time(time("24:00:00")) returns 0.
  • hours-from-time(adjust-time-to-timezone(time("01:23:00+05:00"), dayTimeDuration("PT0S"))) returns 20.
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see hours-from-time

functions.name: implicit-timezone
functions.description: Returns the value of the implicit timezone property set in the platform.
functions.summary: Returns the value of the implicit timezone property set in the platform.

returns.description: the implicit timezone property. For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see implicit-timezone

functions.name: minutes-from-dateTime
functions.description: Returns the minute component of a dateTime.
functions.summary: Returns the minute component of a dateTime.

returns.description:
the minute component of the given dateTime.
  • minutes-from-dateTime(dateTime("1999-05-31T13:20:00-05:00")) returns 20.
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see minutes-from-dateTime

functions.name: minutes-from-duration
functions.description: Returns the number of minutes in a duration.
functions.summary: Returns the number of minutes in a duration.

returns.description:
the number of minutes of the given duration.
  • minutes-from-duration(dayTimeDuration("P3DT10H")) returns 0.
  • minutes-from-duration(dayTimeDuration("-P5DT12H30M")) returns -30.
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see minutes-from-duration

functions.name: minutes-from-time
functions.description: Returns the minutes component of a time.
functions.summary: Returns the minutes component of a time.

returns.description:
the minutes component of the given time.
  • minutes-from-time(time("13:00:00Z")) returns 0.
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see minutes-from-time

functions.name: month-from-date
functions.description: Returns the month component of a date.
functions.summary: Returns the month component of a date.

returns.description:
the month component of the given date.
  • month-from-date(date("1999-05-31-05:00")) returns 5.
  • month-from-date(date("2000-01-01+05:00")) returns 1.
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see month-from-date

functions.name: month-from-dateTime
functions.description: Returns the month component of a dateTime.
functions.summary: Returns the month component of a dateTime.

returns.description:
the month component of the given dateTime.
  • month-from-dateTime(dateTime("1999-05-31T21:20:00-05:00")) returns 5.
  • month-from-dateTime(dateTime("2000-01-01T11:05:00+05:00")) returns 1.
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see month-from-dateTime

functions.name: months-from-duration
functions.description: Returns the number of months in a duration.
functions.summary: Returns the number of months in a duration.

returns.description:
the number of months in the given duration.
  • months-from-duration(yearMonthDuration("P20Y15M")) returns 3.
  • months-from-duration(yearMonthDuration("-P20Y18M")) returns 6.
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see months-from-duration

functions.name: seconds-from-dateTime
functions.description: Returns the seconds component of a dateTime.
functions.summary: Returns the seconds component of a dateTime.

returns.description:
the seconds component of the given dateTime.
  • seconds-from-dateTime(dateTime("1999-05-31T13:20:00-05:00")) returns 0.
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see seconds-from-dateTime

functions.name: seconds-from-duration
functions.description: Returns the number of seconds in a duration.
functions.summary: Returns the number of seconds in a duration.

returns.description:
the number of seconds in the given duration.
  • seconds-from-duration(dayTimeDuration("P3DT10H12.5S")) returns 12.5.
  • seconds-from-duration(dayTimeDuration("-PT256S")) returns -16.0.
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see seconds-from-duration

functions.name: seconds-from-time
functions.description: Returns the seconds component of a time.
functions.summary: Returns the seconds component of a time.

returns.description:
the seconds component of the given time.
  • seconds-from-time(time("13:20:10.5")) returns 10.5.
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see seconds-from-time

functions.name: timezone-from-date
functions.description: Returns the timezone component of a date.
functions.summary: Returns the timezone component of a date.

returns.description:
the timezone component of the given date.
  • timezone-from-date(date("1999-05-31-05:00")) returns dayTimeDuration("-PT5H").
  • timezone-from-date(date("2000-06-12Z")) returns dayTimeDuration("PT0S").
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see timezone-from-date

functions.name: timezone-from-dateTime
functions.description: Returns the timezone component of a dateTime.
functions.summary: Returns the timezone component of a dateTime.

returns.description:
the timezone component of the given dateTime.
  • timezone-from-dateTime(dateTime("1999-05-31T13:20:00-05:00")) returns dayTimeDuration("-PT5H").
  • timezone-from-dateTime(dateTime("2000-06-12T13:20:00Z")) returns dayTimeDuration("PT0S").
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see timezone-from-dateTime

functions.name: timezone-from-time
functions.description: Returns the timezone component of a time.
functions.summary: Returns the timezone component of a time.

returns.description:
the timezone component of the given time.
  • timezone-from-time(time("13:20:00-05:00")) returns dayTimeDuration("-PT5H").
  • timezone-from-time(time("13:20:00")) returns ().
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see timezone-from-time

functions.name: year-from-date
functions.description: Returns the year component of a date.
functions.summary: Returns the year component of a date.

returns.description:
the year component of the given date.
  • year-from-date(date("2000-01-01+05:00")) returns 2000.
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see year-from-date

functions.name: year-from-dateTime
functions.description: Returns the year component of a dateTime.
functions.summary: Returns the year component of a dateTime.

returns.description:
the year component of the given dateTime.
  • year-from-dateTime(dateTime("1999-05-31T13:20:00-05:00")) returns 1999.
  • year-from-dateTime(dateTime("1999-12-31T24:00:00")) returns 2000.
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see year-from-dateTime

functions.name: years-from-duration
functions.description: Returns the number of years in a duration.
functions.summary: Returns the number of years in a duration.

returns.description:
the number of years in the given duration.
  • years-from-duration(yearMonthDuration("P20Y15M")) returns 21.
  • years-from-duration(yearMonthDuration("-P15M")) returns -1.
For a detailed description of the semantics of this function, please see years-from-duration
